2.text: Suffer me a little, and I will tell thee; For there are yet words on God’s behalf.

3.text: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, And will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

4.text: For truly my words are not false; One that is upright in mind is with thee.

5.text: Behold, God is mighty, yet He despiseth not any; He is mighty in strength of understanding.

6.text: He preserveth not the life of the wicked; But giveth to the poor their right.

7.text: He withdraweth not His eyes from the righteous; But with kings upon the throne He setteth them for ever, and they are exalted.

8.text: And if they be bound in fetters, And be holden in cords of affliction;

9.text: Then He declareth unto them their work, And their transgressions, that they have behaved themselves proudly.

10.text: He openeth also their ear to discipline, And commandeth that they return from iniquity.

11.text: If they hearken and serve Him, They shall spend their days in prosperity, And their years in pleasures.

12.text: But if they hearken not, they shall perish by the sword, And they shall die without knowledge.

13.text: But they that are godless in heart lay up anger; They cry not for help when He bindeth them.

14.text: Their soul perisheth in youth, And their life as that of the depraved.

15.text: He delivereth the afflicted by His affliction, And openeth their ear by tribulation.

16.text: Yea, He hath allured thee out of distress Into a broad place, where there is no straitness; And that which is set on thy table is full of fatness;

17.text: And thou art full of the judgment of the wicked; Judgment and justice take hold on them.

18.text: For beware of wrath, lest thou be led away by thy sufficiency; Neither let the greatness of the ransom turn thee aside.

19.text: Will thy riches avail, that are without stint, Or all the forces of thy strength?

20.text: Desire not the night, When peoples are cut off in their place.

21.text: Take heed, regard not iniquity; For this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

22.text: Behold, God doeth loftily in His power; Who is a teacher like Him?

23.text: Who hath enjoined Him His way? Or who hath said: ‘Thou hast wrought unrighteousness’?

24.text: Remember that thou magnify His work, Whereof men have sung.

25.text: All men have looked thereon; Man beholdeth it afar off.

26.text: Behold, God is great, beyond our knowledge; The number of His years is unsearchable.

27.text: For He draweth away the drops of water, Which distil rain from His vapour;

28.text: Which the skies pour down And drop upon the multitudes of men.

29.text: Yea, can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, The crashings of His pavilion?

30.text: Behold, He spreadeth His light upon it; And He covereth the depths of the sea.

31.text: For by these He judgeth the peoples; He giveth food in abundance.

32.text: He covereth His hands with the lightning, And giveth it a charge that it strike the mark.

33.text: The noise thereof telleth concerning it, The cattle also concerning the storm that cometh up.
